trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a name conflict occurs while a strongly typed <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> is being generated.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply" This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The localized error message string.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class by passing in a collection of errors.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> of errors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class with a specified message that describes the error.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The error message string specified in `message`.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class, using the specified serialization information and streaming context.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class with the specified string and inner exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The error message string specified in `message`.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
Gets a dynamic list of generated errors.
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
The error list.
Implements the `ISerializable` interface and returns the data that you must have to serialize the <xref href="System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> object.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).
The <xref:System.Data.Design.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class indicates that a conflict occurred while an attempt is being made to generate a typed dataset class.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> structure.
